meanings.sent1: The puppy's wagging tail and tenderer eyes melted everyone's heart.
meanings.sent2: She spoke in a tenderer tone to comfort her friend who was feeling sad.
meanings.sent3: The tough-looking biker had a surprisingly tenderer side when it came to his pet hamster.
meanings.sent4: Her tenderer approach to discipline made the children feel loved and understood.
meanings.sent5: The tenderer touch of the nurse helped soothe the patient's anxiety.

meanings.definition: Someone who submits a bid for a contract
meanings.sent1: The construction company's tenderer won the bid for the new bridge project.
meanings.sent2: As a tenderer, he carefully prepared his proposal to secure the government contract.
meanings.sent3: The eager tenderer accidentally submitted his bid twice, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: The experienced tenderer knew how to craft a winning proposal that stood out.
meanings.sent5: The diligent tenderer always ensured his bids were thorough and competitive.

meanings.definition: More delicate or soft than usual
meanings.sent1: The fabric of the dress felt tenderer after it was washed with a gentle detergent.
meanings.sent2: The tenderer petals of the flower indicated its freshness and beauty.
meanings.sent3: The tenderer touch of the breeze on her skin made her feel calm and peaceful.
meanings.sent4: The tenderer texture of the cake made it melt in your mouth with each bite.
meanings.sent5: The tenderer glow of the sunset painted the sky in hues of pink and orange.
